alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 14 at 3:24PM MST until January 16 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mountain snow. Additional snow accumulations up to 1 foot expected, with locally higher amounts possible. Dangerous wind chills of 30 to 40 degrees below zero.. * WHERE...Sierra Madre and Snowy Mountain Ranges. * WHEN...Winter Storm Warning until 5 PM MST Monday. Wind Chill Warning until 11 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Extremely dangerous or impossible mountain travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and significantly reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow. Outdoor recreation will be life threatening to those caught unprepared for severe winter conditions. Hikers and snowmobilers can become easily disoriented and lose their way. Frostbite and hypothermia can develop rapidly due to extreme cold temperatures.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
